comment: Professor Rajan is really nice, funny, and quirky. She makes learning interesting for sure. You won't really be bored with her (unless you really hate English). BEWARE! There's a lot of group work/activities and peer review. Making a friend or acquaintance in this class will really help you. I learned the hard way. There are also three essays to do
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: I took Prof Rajan last year and did not like the class. She's a nice lady overall but as a professor, I wouldn't take her again. The assignments aren't clear or organized, grades come in slow, and she's dismissive. I didn't take much away from the class like I had intended, considering I like English. Don't take her if you can get someone else!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She grades everything very subjectively. Her class isn't too hard but I purposely signed up for a class that wasn't hers next semester. She is terrible with technology too, everything is very disorganized. There are is no clear rubric of what she wants, so if what you write isn't what she wants to read, she'll dock off as many points as she wants.

great professor and a very easy class, however she was kinda a tough grader for the 2 essays we had to do in class but that was probably because my writing skills arent the best. i took this as a hybrid class, just do fully online because the class is useless in person but is required. very nice and caring take her fully online though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing professor. Dr.K allows us to take 3 deep breaths at the beginning of the class to help us be present. She gives great feedback. Not a tough grader. Genuinely cares about you. Just be vocal in class, and share your thoughts if any. Quizzes every Tuesday. GET READY TO READ!!!!!! Very quirky teacher. Attendance is mand. Doesn't like phones.

She's a very interesting character: very quirky and spiritual. Her class is boring but she definitely has a passion for English. She gives weekly quizzes (she gives the answers in class). There is a group project that you'll be working on for majority of the semester. Her D2L is a little messy & get ready to read!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Best professor I have taken so far. My class is hybrid so showing up to class once a week was not much at all. Plus even in class, she would just discuss and go over quizzes, and upcoming assignments. I suggest pacing yourself throughout the semester because we did a presentation. Very clear on grading. Quizzes easy. Answers discussed in class.

She struggles to give good feedback on papers.
Her instructions are very unclear.
She expects lengthy papers.
Very harsh grader
Although she is a nice person, just not the best professor. (in my opinion)
Sometimes her feedback can be contradicting.
If you're a "bad" writer DON'T take this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: She was so sweet and fun! She actually cared about her students and made it a point to help them in any way possible. If I could take her for every English class, I would. You have 2 essays and 1 presentation. Other than that, you get graded on participation, a few in class quizzes and a few small papers. Super great teacher!

I hate literature, but she made is as enjoyable as it could possibly be for me. She's an incredibly unique individual who is passionate about what she's teaching. Some homework assignments, discussion posts, quizzes, a group project, and two tests. As long as your trying, she's happy to help you out.
She has some little quirks about her, but overall they make her unique and a great teacher. She was very helpful with the essays and very understanding about my personal situation going on at home.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Papers are very self guided which is nice. She really encourages students to dive into their own interests. However, she has some weird quirks... Extremely strict on phone use during class, weird daily breathing exercises, and the peer reviews are way too long and should be more self guided like the essays.

I don't typically enjoy English or literature classes, but this class was an easy pass and she made it easy to stay engaged. She provided all the required pieces to read and had 2 group assignments and one group presentation. It's super beneficial to go to class before quizzes and exams as she reviews exactly what's on the quiz/exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Dr.K is a nice lady but when it comes to feedback she is very harsh (almost a little too harsh). I enjoyed sharing my one small positive with the class everyday but the reason I would not take her again is the way she gives her feedback and the very loose way she graded her papers. She will help you become a better writer though. 3 major papers!
She is literally amazing. Two papers and they are very flexible, as is Dr. K. Take her!!!

Dr. K teaching helps not only in class but provide valuable lessons as you grow in the future. Yes, this class is world-lit and consists of a lot of reading but she also goes over the summary of each. A group project, a midterm/final STUDY GUIDE your best friend. Yes, attendance isn't mandatory but coming to class is KEY as she gives you answers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I found her class to be really easy. We only had 3 major grades and 10 question quizzes every now and then that were super easy. She lets you write about whatever you want which makes it more fun. She is also very understanding and wants everyone to succeed. I would totally take her class again and would recommend her to anyone.

If you can take Dr. K take her! She is possibly the best English Professor there is on campus. There are only two essays during the course which you can actually send it early to her and she will give you feedback. The final exam is a presentation on the two previous essays you wrote.

She is a very cool teacher, just make sure you read the works. You'll  discuss everything in class. Don't buy the book, you will not use it. Just put in plenty of effort and you will have a good grade. Also you don't have to come to class, but do come for the review before the test because she basically tells you everything on it.

I love her so much! Her lectures bring me so much joy. The class is so positive. All her quizzes are open notes. Please attend all her lectures as she will review answers for the quizzes, midterm, and final. Study guides are provided. Easy A if you come to class. No textbook. Offer zoom if you miss class. You will love her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Dr.K is amazing, she's caring and accepting of others. Her class is not tricky, just do the work and it's an easy A+. If you don't cheat yourself, then blame it on the teacher, you would get more out of her class than a well-deserved grade. Very engaging class, open space for discussions, gives all answers to her quizzes and 2 tests. Genuine person

Dr. Rajan was very engaged in class and gave good lessons that got the class involved. I only say I wouldn't take again because her papers had very loose requirements, and I like a little more structure. But she'll give you as much guidance as possible if you ask. Writing heavy course. Gave me an A on the final paper so yay

Professor Rajan is very energetic and cares about her students. She gives a lot of assignments and gives very intricate feedback that can be a little over the top at some times. Even though her feedback is a lot, she is a very lenient grader and will most likely give you a good grade if it looks like you tried. There are also lots of extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: If you don't show up to class you will miss out on all of her contrarian opinions that she bases the quizzes and midterm questions on. Also, an unreasonably harsh grader for a gen ed class. She offers the lecture on zoom but doesn't even bother to make sure it's working most of the time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Best professor I’ve had at Kennesaw so far. So passionate about literature. She really shows what the beauty of literature is all about. You don’t even have to worry about trying hard to pass her class. She gives you all the material you need to know for quizzes and exams as long as you show up to class.

The sweetest professor and really cares for her students. There is a decent amount of group work so be prepared to talk to some of your classmates. She really goes into detail discussing the works and encourages participation but doesn't force it. The quiz and test questions are discussed and answered in the class prior so show up and take notes.
Got an A in the class. 2 essays and a presentation at the end of class with minor quizzes here and there. The class is pretty easy even if you dont try that hard.

Don't get me wrong, she's a nice lady but I won't take her again. She grades papers based on if your topic interests her. She gives you the opportunity to submit your papers to her before they are due to get her feedback. The feedback she gives is over the top and contradicts itself. 2 papers and a presentation with little directions.
She is the best english teacher Ive ever had man, her class was too easy n its only 2 essays that are about anything you want!

this professor is 10/10! i took her for the second time this semester because she is so great and the papers/projects we do revolve around things we care about (you can chose any subject you want it makes it much easier to do the work trust me) i got an A in ENG 1101 and 1102 with her. TAKE HER

Dr. K is a great prof. She cares about her students. But you NEED to be present. She doesnt care as much about a sob story is you never come during class time. It is a participation grade. Quizzes weekly but she has a review at the end for people that were present and turns off the camera. Very helpful! There was a project but it wasnt too hard.

she is a very nice person overall, but her directions on assignments can sometimes be very confusing. I would definitely get her feedback on the papers because she gives good advice on how to make it better. She gives some extra credit so that's a plus!

When the class first started i was worried because she took a different more personal approach to 1102. However, she is a very nice and caring person. She is a very positive person and it spreads to everyone else and she gives great feedback. As long as you try and bring yourself into the papers you will be fine. I would 100% recommend.

She puts in effort in not just only her work but to her students! She makes sure she relates to all the small positive things the student's dealt with and even the not-so-great days. She's very patient and always calm in every situation. Just a final project and quizzes but she goes over the questions in class. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

THE BEST. My favorite professor Ive had so far. Her classes are very engaging and not just boring lectures. She gives good feedback on all assignments. She does reviews before any quiz or exam and she makes sure you succeed in her class. Amazing professor and in my opinion an easy A if you put the work in.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria

comment: In my opinion, her feedback for papers are way over the top like it's literally a gen-ed class and she treats it as an English major course. She's a sweet lady and all, but how can one be clear on an essay when she's unclear about instructions and all the students are confused as well. I recommend her, but watch out for her feedback. 3 papers too.

A very great person and professor. She really cares more about her students than the work in the class. She welcomes discussion and the exams are over the in-class discussions. She is very passionate about literature and helping others.

This class consisted of participation grades, quizzes on sentence structures, opinionated bonuses, two essays (or 3?), and a project. The class is an "easy A" if she essentially likes your final papers/ project. I had to redo a paper for a slightly increased grade (she gave me a C on it). *Bonuses only add to the MINOR section!! You've been warned*
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: I will never get over how amazing she was. We only 2 essays which were both easy to write because it was about ourselves. I purchased the books but never had to read them. We were always given amazing feedback. She is extremely caring and by far the only English teacher I have ever enjoyed having. I HIGHLY recommend taking her!!

she is so sweet and cares about her students and their interests. we had to be online because of covid but we had weekly scheduled lectures and she made them fun. Only 2 essays and you pick whatever subject you want which makes the papers easy to write! and the final presentation was a powerpoint! barely any textbook reading

The kindest prof I have every had! She is such a lovely woman and makes world lit so much better. The semester consists of a few very short quizzes, one group project, a midterm, and a final exam. Very simple if you read the content and pay attention. You are sure to succeed in this class!!

One of my favorite professors I have ever taken, she is the best and leads great in-class discussions. I wanted longer class times JUST to talk more about what we were discussing as a class. DO THE READING!

Professor K was one of the best professors Ive had by far. She is so kind and checks up on students regularly. Most of the readings were based on the concepts of death and true happiness which led to amazing class lectures! As long as you put in effort, do the readings, and go to class, you should get an easy A.

Shes kinda crazy in class, but she really cares about what she does. The lectures can be kind of boring and the essays are a pain to write. She expects a lot of dedication to the papers and for a lot of time to be put in.

Super easy homework which includes a few grammar quizzes and to work on your paper. She only gives three papers per semester and each one is easy and fun to write. However, she really challenges her students to write from the heart and talk about feelings. So, if you aren't good at expressing feelings on paper, you may get a few bad grades.

Rajan is a very entertaining person. I can tell she cares about what she teaches, and wants her students to care as well. Every grade matters bc there aren't a lot of them. Theres a group project thats super annoying, but other then that, the class is super easy. Just read what is required and review before tests.
Great professor and always positive
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Accessible outside class

comment: This should been a online class. You have to come to class or be expected to have your grade dropped by a letter for 6 absents. She never taught just went over what was on d2l. At first I liked her personality but after a week its starts to get tiring and annoying. We did like 3 big papers just to make a final paper. Her class was a waste of time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Rajan is bubbly and enthusiastic about what she teaches. I don't normally like literature classes, but hers was pretty alright. There's relatively little homework, but you still have to read. You don't have to show up to class, but if you decide not to, you'll miss out on the in class discussions that help you complete the reading quizzes
Easy Class, Funny teacher who is always really peppy and excited to teach. If you need help she is more than willing to help. Good class

A fairly easy class if you're not someone who struggles with writing. If you are, she's one of the most supportive professors I've had and also one of the easiest to talk to, so she'll always be willing to help and give feedback.
Great teacher that is very kind and always willing to help!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you need an easy A take her. She grades on title things and essays are on the topic of your choice. She is very loud and obnoxious at times, but her class is great. I really did not learn anything, but that's okay.

Professor Rajan has to be one of my favorite professors Ive ever had at Kennesaw! She always comes to class with such an upbeat attitude! I took her hybrid class this semester so attendance was mandatory! Everything on d2l is straightforward and she responds back to any emails super fast. Made lit a little more exciting because I get bored easily

A really wonderful teacher, she really cared about all of us and even changed a due date on an extensive week when we asked. I took a hybrid course of hers and it took her a minute to get around d2l, but once she did she was very organized and helped us all out a lot. She clearly wants to help you succeed, which is refreshing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the funniest and most thoughtful people I've ever met. Relate all of your journal entries to improving your writing for a 100 and take her up on reviewing your papers before you turn them in. Overall easy class but you always have stuff to do.

This is one of the best teachers I have ever had. Writing is not my best subject but Dr. K is more than willing to take the time to help and explain. You have 2 Papers, 1 Presentation, multiple book/MLA quizzes, and a Journal. All are easy to pass as long as you show up to class and TRY! She is nutty but so sweet!!! She makes class interesting.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Rajan is fun and truly cares about her students. Sure, there are times she can get dates mixed up, but just remind her and she'll fix it right away. She offers plenty of grades to boost your final grade or leave you some cushion to fall back on. She offers so much help when writing papers, and gives incredible feedback to better students work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. K is a riot! She is super inspirational and loves her job. She's also one of the most funny and energetic professors I have ever had. You have to work for your grade, but she is more than happy to help. We had two papers and a lot of mini assignments here and there. Would recommend!
